p: Further, we screened for general antimicrobial activity by disc diffusion method against representative Gram-positive bacteria ( S. aureus), Gram-negative bacteria ( E. coli), and fungi ( C. albicans). Our results demonstrated a significant difference in antimicrobial activities of tested extracts against test microbes relative to controls (ANOVA, S. aureus; F (3,8) = 160.1, p < 0.001; E. coli, F (3,8) = 53.67, p < 0.001; C. albicans, F (3,8) = 72.67, p < 0.001). The water extract exhibited low general antimicrobial activity in all tested cases (zone of inhibition <10 mm), while the methanolic crude extract gave moderate but broad-spectrum activity, with the highest inhibition of 11.7 mm against E. coli ( Table 2).
